item.title: Holly add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Holly add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Holly add a quote by Malcolm Forbes
item.description: "The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good." -- Malcolm Forbes

item.title: Holly add a quote by Horace
item.description: "He will always be a slave who does not know how to live upon a little." -- Horace

item.title: Holly add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Growth in wisdom can be measured precisely by decline in bile." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Holly add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Holly add a quote by Shirdi Sai Baba
item.description: "Before you speak ask yourself: Is it kind, is it necessary, it is true, does it improve upon the silence?" -- Shirdi Sai Baba

item.title: Holly add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one." -- Charlotte Bronte
